result.execSummary:
The defendant Chevon L Lockett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid within 90 days or penalty of 4 days Huber for non-payment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chevon L Lockett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Chevon L Lockett in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information filed, charge now a misd.  Defendant pleads guilty to amended count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty to amended count #1.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Menden makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following:
Count #1
Fine $452.00 to be paid in 90 days, failure to pay will result in 4 days in jail with huber.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Chevon L Lockett did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called at 8:58 am. Defense has no indication of their clients whereabouts. Court Orders Capias and bail revoked. Case recalled at 9:11 am. Defendant appears with Attorney Menden. Court quashes Capias and reinstates bail. Defendant is still working on obtaining counseling and doing community service. Defense requests a new trial date.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Jury trial - 12 person on July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chevon L Lockett in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests matter be set for trial.  Jury trial expected to last 1 day.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Chevon L Lockett in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on April 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant Chevon L Lockett in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 12, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant to have no contact with Woodman's listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Chevon L Lockett in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:15 am.
